page.title: 01Landscape of the Humber Bank
page.content: The area lies on the banks of the{ {River Humber.}The land was in the past a {drained marsh area} for farming but in recent years has been developed for {industry.}Interesting locations include:{North Killingholme Haven,}a small harbour and industrial area with industry, a pub and two houses for sale. Near here we find {old brick {ponds}with {wild birds. The Humber {Wall,}a sea defence separating the coastal salt marsh and mud from the inland areas. A{disused railway}runs through the area. Three lighthouses, one lived in, others abandoned.The { {smallholding}on Station Road and many large industrial areas. Very few people live in the area which is now dominated by often dangerous industry.
